g.text: L. belongs to the family Plumbaginaceae, is popularly called rakta chitrak, and is found abundantly
wildly growing in India. It is variously used to treat diseases such as inﬂammation, skin diseases, gastric troubles
. It has active ingredients such as plumbagin, naphthaquinone, fatty alcohols, tannins
and sitosterol glycosides. It has been reported that roots of
derivatives and ﬂavonoids. The chemical constituents include plumbagin, palmitic acid and myricyl palmitate
from petrol extract, and plumbagic acid lactone, ayanin and azaleatin from ethyl acetate extract of roots
was evaluated for antitumor activity. It has been reported that the
radiosensitizing effects and combined with radiation increases the tumor killing effect
L. belongs to family Labiateae. It is an aromatic and medicinal herb largely found along
mediterranean sea coasts and Himalayan region of India
leaves were found to have signiﬁcant
antioxidant properties and is extensively used in food industry due to its non toxicity and safety
antioxidants such as carnosonic acid, carnosol, rosmarinic acid, rosmanol, isorosmanol and epirosmanol
leaf extract was evaluated for its ability to protect the liver of mice against radiation-induced histopatholog-
ical alterations. Extract treatment showed a signiﬁcant decrease in lipid peroxidation and increase in GSHcontent
in mice and there was signiﬁcant decrease in binucleated hepatic cells as compared with untreated irradiated
belongs to the family Lamiaceae and is cultivated in several countries. It has remedial and house-
. The fragrance and aroma might be due volatile and essential oil that consists of mixture of
volatile compounds such as terpenes, triterpenoids, ursolic acid and oleanolic acid
are salvinoloc acid (dimer of rosmarinic acid), carnosol, carnosic acid, rosmarinic acid, rosmanol, isorosmanol
tion in rats. Extract treatment resulted in decreased lipid peroxidation, protein carbonyl and NO in brain tissues
and increased SOD and CAT enzymes activities and GSH contents
bial, anticancer, antioxidant, anti-inﬂammatory and radioprotective properties probably due to presence of active
polyphenolic compounds that contains aromatic rings with hydroxyl groups
belongs to family Myrtaceae and is a popular source of clove oil; the essential oil extracted from dried ﬂower buds,
leaves and stem of the tree
. Clove oil is applied externally for relieving pain and promotes healing. It has wide
application in pharmaceutical as well as the fragrance and ﬂavoring industries. Clove oil is an essential oil from
the dried ﬂower buds, leaves and stems of the tree
. The main constituents of the essential oil are
phenylpropanoids such as carvacol, thymol, eugenol and cinnaldehyde
. The radioprotective effect of clove oil
has been studied in rats on certain biochemical parameters against ionizing radiation. It has been demonstrated that
the radioprotective effects of clove oil may be assigned to its capacity to reduce lipid peroxidation, strong reducing
power and superoxide radical scavenging activity owing to presence of the polyphenol as well as trace element
belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is also called
is grown throughout Asia, Africa and America, and also naturalized to Florida and Hawaii
been reported to possess acetyl oleanolic acid, triterpenoids, ellagic acid, isoquercitin, quercetin, kaempferol and
. The radioprotective effects were studied in cultured human lymphocytes;
it was noted that treatment with
leaf extract prior to radiation exposure resulted in signiﬁcant decrease in
seed and leaf extracts were also studied in mice and
found that pretreatment protected mice against radiation-induced sickness and mortality. The histopathological
leaf extract treatment prior to radiation exposure increased villus height,
number of crypts and reduced goblet and dead cells
